column1: Median household wealth for blacks has been relatively constant since 1960.
column2: Median household income has increased for whites and blacks since 1960.
column3: The gap in marriage rate between whites and blacks has grown between 1960 and 2011.
column4: Median household income spiked for whites in the 90's and early 2000's but has since dropped dramatically.
column5: Marriage rate has decreased for whites and blacks since 1960.
column6: Median household wealth isn't much different for whites or blacks than it was in 1960.
column7: The gap in household wealth between whites and blacks has grown between 1960 and 2011.
column8: Marriage rates have steadily decreased since 1960.
column9: The gap in median household income between whites and blacks has grown between 1960 and 2011.
column10: The gap between whites and blacks in median household wealth peaked in the mid 2000's.
column11: There exists a financial gap between blacks and whites.
